news.title: FIRs to curb illegal sand mining in Maharashtra
news.para: The Maharashtra government has ordered strict action against illegal sand mining, including FIRs and prosecutions under multiple laws. This directive empowers officials to act against offenders and prevent environmental damage, revenue loss, and threats to public order. Negligence by officials will result in disciplinary action, and repeat offenders may face preventive detention under the Sand Smugglers Act.

news.title: PM to inaugurate Bengaluru's yellow line metro on August 10
news.para: Narendra Modi, the Prime Minister, is set to visit Bengaluru on August 10. He will inaugurate the Yellow Line Metro. This project aims to ease traffic congestion. The Prime Minister will also initiate Metro Phase-3. This phase received quick approval. These projects are expected to benefit many commuters. The Yellow Line is expected to be operational by August 15.

news.title: Land records doctored for farmhouse colony, ACB files FIR against Ansals, ex-government officials
news.para: After a decade-long investigation, the anti-corruption bureau has filed an FIR against Ansal Housing and associated entities for allegedly manipulating land records in the Sohna Aravalis. Revenue officials are accused of illegally reclassifying protected land to enable the development of farmhouses, violating the Aravali Notification of 1992.

news.title: Visakhapatnam: Cherlopalikhandam township plan back on track after 18 years
news.para: A long-standing land dispute near Anakapalli has been resolved. This allows for the development of a 58-acre integrated township. The project faced delays since 2007 due to land consent issues. The government approved a compensation package for landowners. VMRDA officials believe the project is financially viable. The development will provide housing in a high-demand area.

news.title: MahaRERA says both physical and virtual hearings available after HC directive on hybrid option
news.para: MahaRERA clarified it offers both physical and virtual hearing options, responding to a Bombay High Court directive emphasizing the right to physical presence for justice. While virtual hearings are common, in-person hearings are available upon request. MahaRERA has implemented reforms for efficiency, including pre-notified order pronouncements and urgent matter listings.

news.title: In redevelopment deals, Mumbai residents sweat over fears of managing committee-builder nexus
news.para: In Mumbai's lucrative redevelopment market, housing society managing committees wield significant influence, often leading to underhand dealings with developers. While some committees act in the best interests of residents, others are allegedly involved in corruption, accepting bribes and preferential treatment in exchange for favoring specific builders. This raises concerns about transparency and fairness in redevelopment projects.

news.title: Allahabad HC directs Ghaziabad development body to maintain status quo on demolition notice
news.para: The Allahabad High Court has ordered a status quo on demolition notices issued by the Ghaziabad Development Authority (GDA) concerning alleged illegal properties on public land. The court has directed the district administration and GDA to present a rehabilitation plan for the long-term inhabitants, many from weaker sections, who have occupied the land for 40-50 years.

news.title: Bengaluru: E-khata data entry error lands owner huge tax bill
news.para: As per the sale deed, the built-up area is 1366 sq ft and the car parking area is 180 sq ft. However, the staff at BangaloreOne, despite undergoing a week-long training as claimed by the BBMP Chief Commissioner, mistakenly entered both the built-up area and car parking area as 1366 sq ft, resulting in an inaccurate property record.

news.title: Anand Automotive buys bungalow in Delhi for ₹195 crore
news.para: Auto component manufacturer Anand Automotive acquired a 1,550 square yard bungalow on Kautilya Marg in New Delhi for ₹195 crore, marking a significant property deal this year. This transaction, along with others by prominent figures like Anurag Jain and Aakash Chaudhry, highlights the surging demand for luxury properties among HNIs, driven by investment diversification and personal use preferences.

news.title: Government approves GIS-based master plan of 56 out of 59 Uttar Pradesh cities
news.para: Uttar Pradesh government approved GIS master plans for 56 cities. Kanpur, Rampur and Ghaziabad are awaiting approval. The housing department can view thematic maps and sector-wise data. The final review for Ghaziabad and Kanpur is expected soon. Rampur's plan will be taken up in a few weeks. The state government had set a deadline for approval to secure central grants.

news.title: Odisha governor asks real estate developers to invest in tier II & III cities
news.para: Odisha Governor urges real estate developers to invest in tier II and III cities for balanced urbanisation and sustainable development, emphasising ethical practices. Credai highlighted Bhubaneswar's emergence as a dynamic tri-city cluster with Cuttack and Puri, poised to be among India's top 50 urban centres. The real estate sector's significant contribution to India's GDP and employment generation was also underscored.

news.title: Maharashtra minister proposes draft policy to allow direct land buy for industries
news.para: Maharashtra minister Ashish Jaiswal proposes direct land purchases for industries, bypassing the Land Acquisition Act's high costs and mandatory rehabilitation. This plan aims to grant full land ownership to industries through mutual negotiations, potentially eliminating job provisions for displaced individuals.

news.title: JSW Cement cuts IPO size to ₹3,600 crore; public offer to open on August 7
news.para: JSW Cement will launch its initial public offering on August 7. The IPO size is Rs 3,600 crore. It is lower than the previously planned Rs 4,000 crore. The IPO includes a fresh issue and an offer for sale. Apollo Management and SBI will offload shares. The company will use the funds for a new cement unit and debt repayment.

news.title: About 10% of Kolkata's 3,000 insecure buildings at high risk
news.para: Following recent building collapses after heavy rains, the Kolkata Municipal Corporation (KMC) is initiating a city-wide demolition drive targeting highly insecure structures. The KMC has identified 300 extremely dilapidated buildings, primarily in boroughs I to IX, out of 3,000 listed as needing urgent attention.

news.title: Nashik civic body collects 41% property tax in four months
news.para: Nashik Municipal Corporation collected Rs 111 crore in property tax between April and July. This is 41% of the Rs 275 crore target for fiscal year 2025-26. A rebate program encouraged taxpayers. An 8% rebate was given for full payments made early. The NMC also provided an extra 1% concession for online payments.

news.title: Angel One Founder’s son sells apartment in Mumbai suburb for ₹52 crore
news.para: Vinay Thakkar, linked to Angel One's founder, sold a luxurious Andheri West apartment for ₹52.48 crore. The 3,891 sq ft property fetched ₹1.4 lakh per sq ft, marking a high-value transaction. This deal reflects the resilience of Mumbai's luxury market, driven by demand for premium homes and infrastructure upgrades, despite high interest rates.

news.title: Ujjain IT Park to get an expansion with phase II
news.para: The IT Park in Ujjain is expanding into a second phase on 1.5 acres, driven by high demand from tech firms. MPIDC has appointed a developer for the Rs 50 crore project, aiming to create a robust ecosystem for IT and startups. Phase one, expected to complete by December 2026, has already attracted interest from 20 companies.

news.title: In Chandigarh, property tax cases worth ₹62 crore under litigation in HC
news.para: The Municipal Corporation Chandigarh faces a challenge in recovering over Rs 190 crore from the top 20 property tax defaulters. Approximately Rs 62 crore in property tax arrears are currently under litigation in the Punjab and Haryana High Court. Disputes over land and area assessments are the primary reasons for the legal challenges, hindering the MC's recovery efforts.

news.title: Secunderabad cantonment board to disconnect water supply of six crore defaulters
news.para: Secunderabad Cantonment Board will disconnect water supply. This action is for residents with unpaid bills. The board is owed approximately 6 crore. Many residents have not paid since February 2022. Some owe more than 10 lakh. The board has already disconnected 33 lines.

news.title: Brookfield India REIT posts 13% growth in NOI in Q1 FY26, plans ₹1,000 crore fund raise
news.para: Brookfield India Real Estate Trust (BIRET) reported a 13% year-on-year increase in net operating income, reaching ₹4,986 million for the quarter ending June 30, 2025. The REIT achieved significant leasing and occupancy growth, leading to a 17% year-on-year rise in distribution to ₹5.25 per unit.
